data.4: And taught him to express clearly.
data.5: The sun and moon revolve to a computation;
data.6: And the grasses and the trees bow (to Him) in adoration.
data.7: He raised the sky and set the Balance
data.8: So that none may err against the scales,
data.9: And observe correct measure, weigh with justice, and not cheat the balance.
data.10: He positioned the earth for all the creatures:
data.11: There are fruits of all kinds on it, and date-palms with their clusters sheathed,
data.12: Grain with husk, and fragrant grasses.
data.13: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
data.14: He created man of fermented clay dried tinkling hard like earthen ware,
data.15: And created jinns from the white-hot flame of fire.
data.16: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.17: Lord of the two Easts, Lord of the two Wests.
data.18: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
data.19: He has set two seas in motion that flow side by side together,
data.20: With an interstice between them which they cannot cross.
data.21: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.22: Out of them come pearls and coral.
data.23: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.24: His are the high-sailed vessels in deep ocean like the mountains.
data.25: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
data.26: All that is on the earth is passing,
data.27: But abiding is the glory of your Lord, full of majesty and beneficence.
data.28: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.29: All those there are in the heavens and the earth turn to Him with solicitation, intent on His purpose all the time.
data.30: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.31: We shall soon be free to turn to you, O weary caravans,
data.32: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.33: O society of jinns and men, cross the bounds of the heavens and the earth if you have the ability, then pass beyond them; but you cannot unless you acquire the law.
data.34: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.35: Let loose at you will be smokeless flames of fire so that you will not be able to defend yourselves.
data.36: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
data.37: When the sky will split asunder, and turn rosy like the dregs of annointing oil,
data.38: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.39: Neither man nor jinn will be questioned on that day about his sin.
data.40: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.41: The sinners will be recognised by their marks, and seized by the forelock and their feet.
data.42: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.43: This is Hell the sinners called a lie.
data.44: They will go round and around between it and boiling water.
data.45: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.46: But for him who lived in awe of the sublimity of his Lord, there will be two gardens --
data.47: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.49: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny? --
data.50: With two springs of water flowing through them both. --
data.51: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
data.52: In both of them there will be every kind of fruits in pairs. --
data.53: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.54: Reclining there on carpets lined with brocade, fruits of the garden hanging low within reach.
data.55: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
data.56: In them maidens with averted glances, undeflowered by man or by jinn before them, --
data.57: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.59: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?
data.60: Should the reward of goodness be aught else but goodness? --
data.61: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --

data.65: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.67: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.68: With fruits in them, and dates and pomegranates --
data.69: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.70: In them good and comely maidens --
data.71: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny? --
data.73: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny? --
data.74: Undeflowered by man or by jinn before them, --
data.75: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --
data.76: Reclining on green cushions and rich carpets excellent.
data.77: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?
data.78: Blessed be the name of your Lord, full of majesty and beneficience.
